intro: Archibaccharis caducifolia, commonly known as the Florida holly, is a member of the Asteraceae family and is native to the southeastern United States. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in wetland areas, characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that turn red in the fall. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by small, woody fruits. Its adaptability to moist soils makes it an important species in wetland ecosystems and a common ornamental plant in landscaping.
